alert.note: Alert for Gila; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 6:25PM MST until August 08 at 12:30AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Gila County in east central Arizona... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 1230 AM MST Monday. * At 625 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Horseshoe Reservoir and Oxbow Estates. This includes the following highways... State Route 87 southbound between mile markers 247 and 250. State Route 87 between mile markers 246 and 250. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Tangle Creek, Red Creek, Houston Creek, Dry Wash, Spring Wash, Horse Creek, Wet Bottom Creek, North Fork Deadman Creek, Deadman Creek, Verde River and Sycamore Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
